channel.title: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"
channel.description: I've tried so many different methods to get this working, and searched all over, I want to avoid mapping EVERY SINGLE Coordinate as arrays I'm trying to do something like if plrx >= housex1 && <= housex2 with y coords as well so I can basically define TOWNS, and HOUSES within them. Could someone help me out?

item.title: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"
item.dc:creator: @TOXSIN TOXSIN
item.description:
@TOXSIN wrote:

This snippet isn’t working in the way I implemented it and I’ve been messing with it had it nearly working then It would only load one area and I can’t get my arrays to work the way I want. Damn

Read full topic
item.source: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"

item.title: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Death Style:

hope you’re not performing every check every single time a player moves

Lets add it in the walking packet!

item.title: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"
item.dc:creator: @TOXSIN TOXSIN
item.description:
@TOXSIN wrote:

thanks see the problem was I was doing <= and >= not just < or > so thanks for the help atm I’m writing a region handler that as someone mentioned will load from text once its 100% working and I will probably release this as it will also handle buildings within the regions for owning houses that you can edit in towns. I originally wanted to avoid arrays but the handler has about 16 arrays now for all this and more to come when i start adding regional events. Thanks again

Read full topic
item.source: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"

item.title: Easiest way to check if player is in a "region"
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Dan0194, post:3, topic:546519”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665419.msg4448169#msg4448169 date=1409956662]
You mean something like this?

public boolean inArea(int x, int y, int x1, int y1) { if (absX > x && absX < x1 && absY < y && absY > y1) { return true; } return false; }

You could make a system to load each Area from a text file or something, instead of making 800 different booleans.
[/quote]

public boolean inArea(int x, int y, int x1, int y1) { return absX > x && absX < x1 && absY < y && absY > y1; }

:rolleyes:[/quote]
Same thing, just a matter of readability.

Read full topic
